examples.translation: Camel lost his ear while hoping for a horn.
A little stone may upset a large cart.

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish اوممق (ummak, “to hope, hope for, expect”), from Proto-Turkic *um-.
Cognates
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (um-, “to ask for, covet, hope for”), [script needed] (umdu, “covetousness, desire”), Old Uyghur [script needed] (umuɣ, “an object of desire”), Chuvash ӑмсанма (ăms̬anma, “to want, desire, envy”), Kyrgyz умсунуу (umsunuu, “to hope, expect”), Uzbek umsunmoq, Yakut умсугуй (umsuguy, “to develop passion, have a fancy for”).
